******************************************************
Test #1: Stress, s11
 
Code:

      integer :: i, j
      real(dp) :: res(11,11)
      real(dp) :: x, y
      real(dp) :: posn(2), dislpos(2)
      real(dp) :: theta, cost, sint
      real(dp) :: stress(3)
      real(dp) :: mu, nu, burgers
      call initMaterialData('example_materials_test2')
      mu = 20.0_dp
      nu = 0.3_dp
      burgers = 2.0_dp
      materials(1)%mu = mu
      materials(1)%nu = nu
      materials(1)%burgers = burgers
      materials(1)%dispprefac = 0.25_dp*burgers/(piconst*(1.0_dp-nu))
      materials(1)%stressprefac =0.5_dp*burgers*mu/(piconst*(1.0_dp-nu))
      materials(1)%rcoresq = 4.0_dp
      theta = piconst/6.0_dp
      sint = sin(theta)
      cost = cos(theta)
      dislpos = [0.0_dp, 0.0_dp]
      do i = 1, 11
        x = -10.0_dp + (i - 1.0_dp)*2.0_dp
        do j = 1, 11
            y = 10.0_dp - (j - 1.0_dp)*2.0_dp
            posn(1) = x
            posn(2) = y
            stress = getStressAtPoint(posn,dislpos,cost,sint,1,1,1.0_dp)
            res(j,i) = stress(1)
        end do
      end do
      call prettyPrintMat(res,'Stress, s11')

Output: (Checked with Python module dislfields --- see iPython Notebook 'Dislocation Fields.ipynb')

Test #2: Stress, s22
 
Code:

      integer :: i, j
      real(dp) :: res(11,11)
      real(dp) :: x, y
      real(dp) :: posn(2), dislpos(2)
      real(dp) :: theta, cost, sint
      real(dp) :: stress(3)
      real(dp) :: mu, nu, burgers
      call initMaterialData('example_materials_test2')
      mu = 20.0_dp
      nu = 0.3_dp
      burgers = 2.0_dp
      materials(1)%mu = mu
      materials(1)%nu = nu
      materials(1)%burgers = burgers
      materials(1)%dispprefac = 0.25_dp*burgers/(piconst*(1.0_dp-nu))
      materials(1)%stressprefac =0.5_dp*burgers*mu/(piconst*(1.0_dp-nu))
      materials(1)%rcoresq = 4.0_dp
      theta = piconst/6.0_dp
      sint = sin(theta)
      cost = cos(theta)
      dislpos = [0.0_dp, 0.0_dp]
      do i = 1, 11
        x = -10.0_dp + (i - 1.0_dp)*2.0_dp
        do j = 1, 11
            y = 10.0_dp - (j - 1.0_dp)*2.0_dp
            posn(1) = x
            posn(2) = y
            stress = getStressAtPoint(posn,dislpos,cost,sint,1,1,1.0_dp)
            res(j,i) = stress(2)
        end do
      end do
      call prettyPrintMat(res,'Stress, s22')

Test #3: Stress, s12

Code:

      integer :: i, j
      real(dp) :: res(11,11)
      real(dp) :: x, y
      real(dp) :: posn(2), dislpos(2)
      real(dp) :: theta, cost, sint
      real(dp) :: stress(3)
      real(dp) :: mu, nu, burgers
      call initMaterialData('example_materials_test2')
      mu = 20.0_dp
      nu = 0.3_dp
      burgers = 2.0_dp
      materials(1)%mu = mu
      materials(1)%nu = nu
      materials(1)%burgers = burgers
      materials(1)%dispprefac = 0.25_dp*burgers/(piconst*(1.0_dp-nu))
      materials(1)%stressprefac =0.5_dp*burgers*mu/(piconst*(1.0_dp-nu))
      materials(1)%rcoresq = 4.0_dp
      theta = piconst/6.0_dp
      sint = sin(theta)
      cost = cos(theta)
      dislpos = [0.0_dp, 0.0_dp]
      do i = 1, 11
        x = -10.0_dp + (i - 1.0_dp)*2.0_dp
        do j = 1, 11
            y = 10.0_dp - (j - 1.0_dp)*2.0_dp
            posn(1) = x
            posn(2) = y
            stress = getStressAtPoint(posn,dislpos,cost,sint,1,1,1.0_dp)
            res(j,i) = stress(3)
        end do
      end do
      call prettyPrintMat(res,'Stress, s12')
